comment.author: 11151551@N08
comment._content:
The "DELPHIC" was build in 1897 for the Oceanic Steam Navigation Co., Ltd. (Ismay, Imrie & Co.), Liverpool, BR.
Build by Harland & Wolff, Ltd., Belfast, yard number 309
Measurements : 475.9 x 55.2 Feet, 8,273 GRT.
Engines : 2 Triple Expansion Steam engines, which gave her a speed of 12 knots
Passenger & Cargo vessel
She was Torpedoed and sunk by UC 72, on 16 Aug 1917, 135 miles SW ¾ W of Bishop Rock, on voyage Cardiff - Montevideo, coal
(5 people died )
